text: Saya menikmati menginap disini karena diberikan Free Voucher dari Bon Odori Festival 2015, merupakan sebuah keberuntungan bisa merasakan menginap di villa ini meski hanya satu malam. Awalnya saya berkeliling kuta dan seminyak karena mengira nama villa tsb adalah nagisa , rupanya nagisa merupakan nama management yang menaungi beberapa villa , tak sengaja lewat saya melihat nama villa tsb seperti nama yg tertulis dalam voucher yg semula saya pikir nama untuk kamar yg akan kami tempati, ternyata betul kalau villa itu adlh yg dimaksud dalam voucher. Setelah lelah berkeliling mencari villa di siang hari yang sangat panas akhirnya kami temukan. Disana saya disambut langsung dengan manager reservasi Villa tsb, penyambutan yg sangat ramah meskipun saya dan suami mengenakan hanya dtg dgn motor dan berpakaian yang yah tidak menunjukan org yang mampu menginap di Villa itu dgn tampang yg cukup kucel krn panas dan lelah berkeliling, tapi beliau menyambut kami dgn sangat ramah, beliau mengantar kami lgsg ke kamar menjelaskan beberapa fasilitas di kamar dgn sangat ramah. Setelah kami beberapa lama kami mencoba menyalakan televisi tetapi saat itu televisi tidak mengeluarkan suara, lgsg kami menghubungi staff hotel dan beliau dtg kembali untuk mengecek televisi kami yg ternyata saat itu settingannya terubah oleh tamu yg menginap di kamar itu sblm kami, beliau lagi2 melayani kami dgn sangat ramah. Sungguh kesan pertama yang sangat baik, beliau jg memberikan rekomendasi makanan enak disekitar villa. Saya sangat karena secara keseluruhan pelayanan yang kami terima sangat menyenangkan. Untuk anda yang ingin menginap di BALI bersama keluarga ataupun bersama pasangan untuk honeymoon, villa ini sangat recomended

text:
Arranged pick up from airport, very easy to find driver,who greated us with a warm welcome. Check in was fast and we were taken to our villa, cool towel and welcoming drink on arrival, shown around villa and breakfast selection choosen and time on when you would like it. Staff very welcoming and made to feel at ease.
Villa is gorgeous, very spacious, Huge bed and bathroom to die for ( especially the massive bath) 
Bed is so comfortable. Safe in room. Very secure Villa, no one can get in as have to go through front past security, always have someone at security and front desk.
Everyday you select the time and what you want for breakfast. Good selection  to choose from.
Has everything you need to cook and make tea/coffee. Big fridge( really cold) and it has a freezer. 
Must say the water temperature was the best we've ever had in Bali, first time that we actually got HOT water.
Have options for massage in room, sooo amazing. 
This is our first stay at a villa and i dont think I would go any where else, staff, atmosphere, location so amazing. Never heard other quests.
We wish we got everyone's name but stand outs were Sari,lovely smiling happy lady who made you feel such warmth and Wawan who cooked most of our breakfasts, such an attentive young man who would assist in anything you needed. 
I can not fault this Villa,  everyone so accommodating and welcoming.
Won't be the last visit.
We highly recommend you stay here, you won't be disappointed 
10/10

text:
Travelled with 2 adults and a toddler. We arrived at around 7pm to Villa Pucuk, a 2 BR villa and were extremely disheartened. Everything that could go wrong, went wrong in that villa. The last straw was that the aircond was not working. It was not the 5 stars rated villa we were hoping and paying for. 

We wrote to the management that very night. 

The next day, Wira, the operations manager came around and from then on saw to our whole holiday experience, basically making us forget our terrible first night. 

We were moved to the next door villa, with much bigger space around the pool area and the balcony, clear pool waters, and working aircond. Things were looking up. All our misgivings about this place began to fade away as we enjoyed swimming in the pool every morning with our baby and enjoyed the morning and evening sun on the lounger on our balcony. Our laundry were picked up by the staff to be sent to the nearby laundromat on a daily basis. The bed is large and comfortable, and fits my husband, my baby and I comfortably. I would definitely recommend the management to change the sheets though as some of it felt worn. 

Breakfast was so so but the fruit juices was delicious, although they gave us a jug on our first day but proceeded to give us only glasses the next few days. The villa and the pool is cleaned twice daily with a turndown service offered every evening. 

Location unbeatable. We didnt walk as we were with baby and the pathway from the villa up to the beach and the row of shops were quite narrow with passing motorbikes, but if we were single adults we definitely would! So so near to Legian Beach which is much much cleaner and less crowded than Seminyak Beach! Legian Beach also offers rental beanbags, beach umbrellas, paddleboards and drinks at a very affordable price. From there on you can head to Azul Beach Club and sit at the sunset pod for the ultimate sunset experience. 

We already had transportation for 1st and 2nd day. But from the 3rd day onwards, we used Nagisa Villa's transportation and driver, Alet. SO SO COMFORTABLE compared to the other vehicles we had. Alet was so accommodating and smiled all the time! 

One person I'd like to highlight was the receptionist, Pandir (i think) who made our first night at the villa a lot better. We had an emergency to attend to and had to leave to the airport right after we arrived, and Pandir was so helpful with the logistics and basically sat with us a good half an hour sorting out the mess. While we were at the airport, there was baby food delivery to our villa, and Pandir did not hesitate to pay 500k rupiah first on our behalf. Exactly the kind of balinese hospitality we had gotten used from our 1st and 2nd visit to Bali. Thank you, Pandir!! 

All in all, it was a good 6 days 5 nights stay if you discount the first night. Wira, Pandir, Alet and the general staffs were so helpful and accommodating. Wira constantly messaged us asking if we're okay and if we needed anything else and it was this personalised touches that made a whole lot of difference. 

Nagisa Villas Management, your villas are  beautiful although maintenance may be needed especially for the things that i have written in the email and above, but your staffs were impeccable and made our holidays that much better.

Thank you!

Our 2 Bedroom (double story) Villa with private pool was AMAZING the pictures you see on the website is exactly what you get. 
As this was our second trip to Bali we wanted a central location however tucked away from all the loud noise this place gave it to us!
With only a two minute walk from our villa to shops and restaurants and about a five minute walk to the commonwealth bank nothing was ever far.
Moo Moos and Mozzarella top rated restaurants in Legian were literally at the end of our street! 
The staff here were GREAT always smiling and happy to help with any questions or concerns. They went above and beyond offering to take us to Kuta to purchase liquor from the store one night as we ran out .. they just were super👌🏽!
We had the breakfast menu included with our stay where staff would come in and cook daily they were just fantastic and meal size was filling. We’ve made some life long friends here at Beautiful Bali Villas. 
If your looking for a modern style, clean, central location however quite at night this place is definietly a winner! We’ve found our new Bali stay 😁😁😁
title: Highly Recommended Stay

text:
What a beautiful stay in these well maintained villas. The staff were very friendly and were always happy to assist when needed. The security at the door after hours was always very polite and enjoyed knowing where we were going and where we’d been. All staff happy to organise a trusted taxi on request and advise us on Bali tourist tips.

We booked through ‘Air B & B’ with no issues. Every morning we had staff come to our villa to cook us a nice breakfast which we chose from a menu the night before. Ample food. Shortly after they left us to enjoy our breakfast they came back to clean the room etc which included maintaining pool and small outdoor area.

Our villa had privacy from other villas and we felt that our belongings were secure when we left the premises. They provide a small safe also. We did however have a villa backing onto a busy road which was quite noisy during day. A sacrifice for having a villa with plenty of hours sun! The glass/walls was think enough to muffle this at night. No problem sleeping. 

On a side note, the warrung across the road had nice food and delicious freshly squeezed juices along with other cold beverages which was very convenient  even though Padma and Legian very short strolls away.

A big shout out to Pipith and Sari at the front desk who were always around and doing a great job! 

Thanking the community.

text:
So this is actually a tough review. First of all the staff are amazing and is what makes this place so beautiful. They are always happy to assist with a smile and any information you might need. 
The fresh breakfast cooked every morning in your villa is a wonderfull idea!
The villa itself is nice but not beautiful. We stayed in the 3 bedroom villa and while each room has everything you will need, there needs to be some work done on them. Water damaged walls with plaster bubbling is not ideal. The air con in room 1 was only just able to keep the room cool even when it was set 16 deg for 12 days straight. The aircon on the last night also decided to leak water during the night all over the bedroom floor. 
The window in room 3 has mould growing up the window.
The pool is lovely after a hot day of sight seeing HOWEVER I can’t warn anyone enough how slippery the area surrounding the pool can be and the stairs leading to the bedrooms. I actually slipped and fell down the stairs (no cocktails had been consumed either). Another guest slipped and fall pool side on the wet tiled area. I would not recommend a family with children stay here unless this is fixed. 
The surrounding pool area could do with a little clean, the mould growing on the pool features does create a bad smell which other reviews have mentions. The pool itself was always clean.
The location is good with only a short walk to the main shopping and restaurant areas. I would have scored this review one star less had it not been for the staff. 
My recommendation for the owner of the villa is start putting some money back into your investment. Staying here is not the cheapest option so expectations are always going to be high when the asking price is high. Had we fallen over in Australia it can easily lead to legal action and I feel taking advantage of Bali’s relaxed laws is a bit cheeky for an international villa owner who is making a lot of money from the amazing place.
title: Tough review

Facilities are excellent, staff are excellent - helpful & hospitable and the location is great.

See you soon ;-)

text:
We were suppose to get a one luxury bedroom villa with private pool that we had order the 10th September, we had already everything planned. And after the check in they provided us a totally different apartment that had lower quality and standard for the same price, it even smelled bad and was noisy!! Because where we were suppose to stay was occupied by someone else. 

Their airbnb page ( we booked through airbnb) had no info or picture that said we could get another apartment with lower standards in case of no availability. When we contacted the host of airbnb, they said they changed the room cause of overbooking without telling us anything even through they have my email and phone number to contact me easy. They tried to offer us 3 different choices. Either free transport only to airport, or a bit discount, or another villa with a lot lower quality for same price. 

The whole day was ruined because they were not concern about answering fast to fix this in any possible way. They even took 1 hour to answer a simple question, total were we waiting 4-5 h and knowing we were waiting at the complex reception even dared to hanged up the phone call without any answers instead of fixing the problem. 

At the end they tried to blame the problem on us, and didn't want to find other ways to solve this. We had to refund through airbnb and find another place. We are sharing this because no one else should go through this on their holidays and waste so many hours with emotional stress of having something planned and suddenly realize they don't care about you as a guest, but only for more money. 

This is a scam, normally if they would care, they would give us more benefits to fix the mess, instead they gave us worst and didn't care and just wanted our money!! They didn't even admitted they were wrong and made a mess so everything seemed like they did it on purpose just to earn more money.This is the worst vacation experience after many years of traveling around. I don't recommend this place to anyone!
title: DOUBLE BOOKED, no info or warnings!

text:
I stayed in Beautiful Bali Villas for 2 nights of luxury after 2 weeks of diving the Gili Islands. The Villas was really spacious for one solo traveller!

A gem of a place that's tucked away down a side street close to the action in Legian but secluded enough to have no issues with noise etc...Lovely accommodation and staff. They were even kind enough to allow me a late check-out which worked out perfectly to get straight to the Airport without any fuss. 

I was asked to pick my preferred time for breakfast when i checked in and the staff would come around in the morning and cook/serve my breakfast and coffee in front of me in the comfort of the Villa!! Never had such service anywhere before!!! The warmth and hospitality I received at every encounter was commendable.

I was made to feel very welcome from start to finish - all the staff members I had the pleasure of meeting are a credit to the place. Well done and thank you for providing a lovely finish to my break. You can be proud of the standard of service you provide!

Fellow travellers.....If you want to treat yourself to a spot of indulgence and an escape from the hustle and bustle then these Villas should be on your list. Granted, its a few quid compared to alternative accommodation choices - personally I felt that it was worth every penny. Think it would be a great place for a couple or family to kick back and make the most of the facilities
title: Name sums it up! Clean, spacious and secluded Villas with great service

text: We were a group of two couples, spent 8 nights Holiday in Bali. The villas complex is somehow outside of the main roads but that was nice in a way - quiet and relaxing. Location was very good otherwise, close to Legian + Kuta beach and shopping areas. We were welcomed by the staff with some refreshing towels and cold drinks, staff members were nice and supportive all the time. The villa has an open living + kitchen & pool area. We appreciated the water dispenser for cool water and warm beverages. The wood furniture in the kitchen area needs some care at some point because of the humidity. The bedrooms at the 1st level were well spaced, nicely arranged for our arrival. Daily maintenance and cleaning was fine, we had our pool towels missing for a couple of days though. There were some issues with the internet connection but those were solved as soon as we reported them. The hotel manager helped us with some tour recommendations and arranged a driver for us. The driver was very nice, supportive and helpful during our touring of the island. To summarize, our stay at BBV was a very nice experience.
title: Lovely Holiday in Bali

text: We had booked 2 bedroom villa for our family of 3. When we first arrived we were shocked about the roads and outside looks of the area - they were really poor and in bad condition. After entering our villa bad surprises continued - villa outdoor door lock was broken and not working at all, the welcoming drinks were hot as a tea though they were placed in the refrigerator (outside was +30 degrees), the chairs and tables in the pool area opened living room, and toilet were so dirty (dusty) that I needed to clean them before sitting. One bedroom had a broken airconditioning (making heavy noise after every few minutes)  so it was impossible  to sleep there. After telling about all the problems and issues and showing our discontent suff started to find solutions. As some of the problems were incurable we were given opportunity to choose another villa. So after moving to our preffered villa and checking everything first, everything was improving and good. We were really disappointed at first how everything was, but thanks to the stuff  (specially one young lady) and theire effort to find solutions everything went well and we really liked the other villa and the whole stay. Breakfast team was also great and breakfast was really good and fresh. So all in all we loved this place though it was little bit pricy for Bali.
title: First impression was a shock, but overall a good experience.

text:
Travelers: Mum, Sister [28] and myself [26]
Room: 2 Bedroom Villa

~PROS~
When we first arrived in Legion we were greeted very warmly by the staff. They were very professional and welcoming. We had a personal staff member names Annga [Forgive my spelling] who gave us a full tour of the villa and showed us everything that we would need to know. 

The rooms were VERY spacious and the Beds were super comfy with plenty of pillows. The bathrooms were perfect, with great large tub that had perfect view of the pool and outdoor area. 

Breakfast, was made to our liking every morning and even when requested some pancakes it was no problems. 

The unlimited chilled water was a perfect addition to our trip, saving those few extra dollars instead of buying so many bottles of water. 

The pool was very luxurious and big enough for all of us. The only small downside was the sun. The sun only covered about a 3rd portion of the pool for a few hours midday. However the upstairs lounge had full coverage the whole day. This made it somewhat bothersome for the sun lovers, needing a quick dip in the pool to cool off. It meant walking back through the house and down the stairs. Not a huge issue, but something to note. 

By Day 2- we had asked for a potential upgrade [to our own expense] knowing that there were potential 3 bedroom villas. Snoring seemed to be a bit of a holiday breaker for some :)

For an extra $60aud a night they upgraded us to the 3 bedroom villa. 

Now this WAS amazing! Each tiny TINY flaw we found in the 2bedroom was rectified.  

The sun now possessed a large portion of the pool and the outdoors and was about double the size. The outdoor area was opened which created a much more holiday appeal which we loved. The fans helped keep the mozzies away. 

The Smallest of cons and notes~~~
Aeroguard / mozzie repellent is a must. Where the villa's are located by a long river there are mosquitoes around all times of day. If the mozzies love you, spray up.

Location!
Inside the villa it is incredible quiet and peaceful. However to get this, you need to be a bit further away from the hustle and bustle. About a 5 miniute walk to get to the main strip of Legion and the beach. Make sure you turn right as soon as you leave the Villa and keep walking straight. 
We were cautioned by our taxi driver on the way that it was not 'safe' for us to walk around the other direction especially at night. The one road to the right however is fine we walked home each night no troubles. 

Tip with Taxi - Make sure you get the BlueBird cabs, and grab a business card / exact address of the Villa from the staff. A lot of taxi's have no idea where it is. If all else grab the App on your phone to order and select destination. 

Overall this was an amazing stay!!! 
Every single staff member we walked past said good morning or good afternoon and questioned us on how our day was going or plans. Always happy to help and accommodate.
title: As beautiful as the name states!

text: We have stayed at these villas before, and this time we had a three bedroom villa with a pool.   Like before, the service was good and the villa was clean, with the bedrooms each having an air conditioner and ensuite.  The villas are located along a very narrow laneway, which stays pretty busy all day and alot of the night, but we weren't effected by road noise.  It is very easy to walk from the villa to the heart of Legian, with its restaurants and shops, and if you walk a bit further you'll find the beach.   We have stayed in quite a few places in Bali, and this is definitely one of my favorites.    I think the only minor issue we had this time was that there were six of us and we just couldn't get enough towels for the pool - the last couple of days we had none as they took them away to be washed.  This was a very minor issue however and I highly recommend Beautiful Bali Villas to anyone that wants to stay in a lovely villa in a great location.
title: Second time we've stayed, and still great

text:
We stayed 4 nights at the Beautiful Bali Villas and simply loved it.
Absolutely nothing more could the staff have done to make our our stay one of the best Bali holidays we have had. 
We arrived and instantly greeted with "welcome home" and they really did make you feel welcome.
The villas are only a short work to the shopping strip of Legian with many very good restaurants nearby.
We had lovely western breakfast cooked in our villa daily. We also had the pleasure of having their chef cook us two delightful dinners, again in our Villa.

The one bedroom villa we stayed was well appointed, clean and comfortable. It was a very private villa and we never felt that anyone could intrude on our privacy. The pool was also clean and warm with access from all parts of the villa.
We loved it so much we booked for week next year before we left. Highly recommended.

The one other observation we would make is that, On first impressions the area looks a little out of the way and the villas are not well known by the taxis (at least the ones we hired) so we would should you download a map from google maps before you go.
title: Staff couldn't be more helpful

text: The moment I arrived outside the villa I was warmly welcomed. Thereafter, my arrival was celebrated with more and more good service. It was a complete 5-star hotel experience staying at this villa. The villa is extremely beautiful you will never regret. The staff will definitely meet your every need and expectation. Any issue that you face, they will try their level best to assist you. They do not fail to make you feel safe. Having experience working in a 5-star hotel myself, I am fully aware of the brand standards and the staff here really live up to it.  I just love how their verbiage feels very familiar to me and they really accede to all of it. Reflected that they are really well-groomed in terms of service. The location may seem to be quite dodgy at first. About a 3 to 5 min walk from the main street (Jalan Legian) as it is quite poorly lit at night and there weren't much activity. It takes some getting used to. Stayed with my 2 girl friends and we walk through that street every night. We survived. Hence, it is probably quite safe. There is a stall that sells local food opposite the entrance - really cheap and convenient. Otherwise, In-room (or should I say 'In-villa') dining is available as well. I had friends who came over for drinks and we needed some amenities like ice or soft drinks. The staff extended his service by giving my friend (who isn't even an in-house guest) a ride out to the nearest convenience store and it was really quite late. The service here is first-class.
title: Really Beautiful with one of the best services

Had a fantastic time in a 2 bedroom Villa . The Villa was great , very spacious, clean and modern . Staff kept the villa spotless and breakfast was lovely . We loved having a pool to ourselves . 
The roll out bed for our teenager was terrible , after 2 nights we asked for a replacement , a mattress was put on the floor which was much better . Very glad we didn't have the open aired lounge room and kitchen ( 3 bedroom villa) as there are lots of mosquitos around and for two nights we had people partying in other villas with very loud music . 
The only complaint we really had was with the safe , twice we returned to our Villa and our safe was open. Nothing was taken out of the safe either times which was very strange.. The first time we went straight to the management , they checked video footage outside the villa and said nothing was found . We have no idea what was happening .. 
Overall we loved the villas and the location . The staff were extremely helpful , friendly and would do anything to make our stay more enjoyable .

text: We booked in to what we thought would be, as the title describes, Beautiful Bali Villas - When you first walked into the 3 bedroom Villa, it looked lovely, until you had a closer look.  The pool had minimal sun, no day beds, no sun lounges and green mould all over the tiles of the pool, when you went to the rear end of the pool it smelt like a sewer, there was grit on the bottom of the pool.  Next - bathrooms, I had to asked to have my toilet cleaned 3 times, it was filthy.  The toilet down stairs leaked - I got the staff to fix it 3 times to no avail.  Breakfast, no variety, was OK, only had it 3 times because when I saw the dish cloth, I nearly vomited.  Noise, very noisy, as it is on a very busy lane way, there were fires burning rubbish every night next door, so you couldn't breathe.  One other Villa was having parties, we complained twice, which the level turned down at 1.00am, the last night was 4.00am, we gave up. Mozzies, we had spray, burnt coils, I have been to Bali 15 times and have always seen the resorts sprayed about 5.00pm - not once - we have just got back and my daughter has contracted Dengue Fever - The only positive thing were the staff.  I would never stay at this place again.  You think you are staying in luxury, far from it!
title: No so beautiful Villas of Bali

Nothing is too much of an ask and they kindly let us have the villas until after 1pm the day we were flying home. Only suggestion would be for a bottle opener in room. text:
There are 10 villas on the property ranging from 1 to 3 bedrooms (although I think they can join some villas to make for even larger groups).

The property is extremely clean and well maintained.

We stayed in the property for 13 nights with 2 young children. The staff were exceptionally helpful, especially the manager, Agung. One of our biggest disappointments was that their credit card facility was not working which meant the cash we had reserved for a reasonably large tip (AUD100) was used to settle our bill.

This is not a secluded part of Legian, it's quite busy - there is a reasonably constant level of ambient sound (lets face it the most important part of any motorcycle or car in Bali is the horn). Having said that they have tried to make the best use of plants and walls to make it feel a little less like you are in a busy part of Bali.

With 2 young children we really liked the 24 hr onsite security.  I feels like a hybrid between a full on private villa and a serviced apartment complex, which suited us.
title: Very pleasant and helpful staff. Great location

text:
We stayed at these villas for 6 nights.  They are well presented and clean, the staff friendly and unobtrusive.  Nothing was too much bother.  We appreciated having free wifi as we have 2 teenagers.

The reason for an average rating is that little things let this place down.

There where no lounges around the pool so we couldn't really relax out there and only 2 beach towels (4 of us stayed).  We stayed in villa 10 which backed onto the road and it was verrrry noisy, most times we didn't open the big sliding doors.

We aren't big party people so each evening we would return to the villa around 9pm and settle in with dvd's or tv.  The list of channels we were given about 50% of them didn't work.

The showers are "rain" showers and unfortunately it sprayed everywhere when we used it.

The sunbed upstairs was stained and moldy. 

The breakfast each morning was lovely, but I have to admit that we would have liked a cereal option.

As I said this place is well presented and clean, the staff are lovely and if you intend spending more time out than in then this is a great choice being so close to Jalan Legian, but if you want to just hang out and chill around the pool and villa, this may not be the place.
title: Great staff, well presented property

text:
We are here in Bali for a few weeks traveling around.Stayed at Beautiful Bali Villas for 5 days last week.We found it to be excellent choice from interior to bed quality,service and breakfast was so good.Every morning they cooked for us Pancakes,omelettes or Nasi Goreng. Staff was always welcoming and they showed us there new Herb Garden.
We walked to the Beach most days and relaxed in the pool villa at night.Price we paid was good value too.It is very private and secure which was comforting for me.My Husband loved sport choices on there TV as well.
title: so Good

text: Stayed 3 nights in a 1 bedroom villa with my husband.  A little hard to find at first as its a one way street for taxi or car.  A little underwhelmed at arrival, as check in area a little shabby and staff english is limited.  But then after entering the gates, a lovely brand new villa awaited.  Unfortunately the power was off for a few hours and villas air con was off as well as the water, which was a worry at first, so we went for a few hours walk through the nearby streets of Legian with plenty of shopping and restaurants close by.  Luckily on our return the power was back on.  The villa is spacious for 2 people with beautiful decor/furniture.  There is a separate lounge and dining area with 3D TV and kitchenette.  There is large sliding doors that open up straight onto the pool area.  The separate bedroom is large with a very comfortable bed and pillows and good quality linen.  Ensuite bathroom is amazing, with large separate bath and shower which also has large sliding doors that open onto pool area.  Air conditioning was great, one in living area and one in bedroom.  The pool was a great temperature, cool enough to enjoy on the hot days and nights, had a lovely fountain and was very clean.  Larger than a plunge pool, more like a lap pool.  There were two bean bag chairs in the small poolside area.  The breakfast was included, although it was very basic.  Fruit and toast or banana pancake or indonesian nasi was offered along with juice, tea or coffee (the coffee is not what we are used to it was thick turkish style?)  We decided to eat out for breakfast after the first morning which was a little disappointing but didn't bother us as we did not want to offend the lovely young staff by not eating what they cooked again.  Staff were not intrusive and left us alone.  Towels were clean and soft.  The location was close to shopping in Legian St and Padma which we found convenient as we had stayed in Legian before, although the narrow, dark lane way was a little scary at night when walking home.  We did not have a problem at night walking home but just be aware.  It was an easy 7 minute walk down to Legian beach.  We stopped at Padma Resort for breakfast each morning which was amazing for AUD23 per person.  We would recommend Beautiful Bali Villas (which are owned by an Aussie) to others who are wanting a villa in the heart of the Legian area which is hard to find.  We would stay again for a few nights on our next trip.
title: Hidden Gem in Legian

text:
As we walked into the beautiful bali villas, we realised why Bill has named them so (quite understatingly). Drop dead gorgeous bali villas would be more closer to the description. We walked through the small plantation esque lane way inside the villa complex and opened the old style doors into our own private villa - complete with drop pool!

Imagine our glee as we turned on the lights and lo and behold, the bathroom downstairs even opened up into the pool, so you could go straight from your bath and take a dip into the well lit pool during a hot evening. 

The location itself was great - central enough to walk everywhere and far enough away to get away from the traffic. PS. across the road, try the avocado shakes, for 80 cents, they are not only a steal, but a great mid afternoon refresher!

Don't be fooled, this isnt one of those villas where you get the backpackers, this is the kind of villa you would go for if you wanted that elegance with a homely feel - perfect for a boys week (like us) or a honeymoon alike.

The marble flooring just oozed royalty without being too over the top like some high end hotels. This was like staying at a 6 star hotel - at 1 /10th of the price. 

The staff there were always courteous and helpful and turned down and cleaned the rooms multiple times a day! Lets not forget the private chef who suggested that he serve us breakfast - in the pool itself!

A trip to bali is incomplete with out staying here!
title: quite possibly the most beautiful villas I have ever laid my eyes on.

photos.caption: The view as you enter your room (2 bedroom villa)

text:
If you are looking for a great spacious villa with private pool then this is definitely the place to come.  Great location a short walk from a main road with plenty of bars and restaurants.  Only about 10 minute walk to the beach or about 15minutes walk (or very cheap taxi ride) to the nighlife of Kuta bars and clubs if thats your scene.

The villa itself was everything that I had hoped for from the pictures.  The rooms were large and spacious and the bathroom opening out directly to the pool was awesome.  Shower, jump splash, your in the pool!  Wifi and AC was good and no issues with mosquito's or other bugs in the rooms or around the pool area.  A small amount of road noise from mopeds going past (we were in the last villa down the path) but was only really noticeable while in the pool area and didn't bother us at all during the stay.  

The entire staff team there were friendly and attentive and the breakfast cooked right in your villa was always on time and excellent quality.  They were also very helpful in booking day trips for whatever we planned or helping with recommendations in the area.  Great thanks to our driver for the trip to Ubud and the safari, sorry I can't remember his name but was very friendly and provided good information about Bali life during the day between locations.

All I can say is that this is a really great place to stay and relax away from the busy street shops and markets but close enough to everything that you could want.  This was my first trip to Bali but if I return I would definitely stay at Beautiful Bali Villas again.  Great job team!
title: Great place to stay in Bali Legian area.

text:
We stayed 3 nights in April 2015 at the Beautiful Bali Villas on Jalan Padma Timur in Legian, which is a relatively new property. It sits one block away from Jalan Legian which is the main “thoroughfare” taking you from Seminyak to Kuta (south for Kuta, north for Seminyak). The area has an abundance of shops and market stalls, restaurants, cafes and bars and some money exchange places (safest to go to the ones that specifically say “no rip-off” on their signs). If wanting to go to the beach, simply walk down Jalan Padma Timur and cross Jalan Legian, then continue heading west along the same street (although the name changes to simply, Jalan Padma). This may take you approx. 15 - 20mins depending on how fast / slow you stroll.
The villas are surrounded by high walls to ensure privacy. There are villas that have an open air living area as well as fully enclosed villas. We stayed at Villa 11 called “Pucuk” (pronounced “pu-chook”) which is a double storey fully enclosed villa. On entering the complex through double wooden doors, you walk through a narrow walkway flanked on either side by tall bamboo and other leafy plants. Depending on which villa you are in, it could seem like you are walking through a small maze.
When arriving at villa 11 and the gate is swung open, the first thing you notice is the beautiful pool (approx. 3m x 6m) right in front of you with a wall of floor to ceiling tempered glass sliding doors facing you from the other end. To the right of the pool is a small timber deck with two chairs and a water fountain statue pouring water into the pool. To the left is the front door to the villa itself.
Step inside the front door and you walk into the open plan living / dining / kitchen area. On your left is a solid wall with a TV on a stand and a water cooler in the corner with both chilled and boiling water. The wall straight ahead is also solid which backs on to the villa next door. The furnishings are not-so-much Balinese (except for a couple of local painters’ art pieces) but more of a 1970’s semi-retro look. Turning right you will find a round dining table and four chairs that look out onto the pool through a wall of clear floor to ceiling sliding doors (for days where you might want to jump straight from breakfast to pool). Further back from the dining table is the kitchen area set against a wall with stove, oven, microwave, sink, kettle and bar fridge. There are plenty of cupboards and drawers if you should need them. 
To the right past the kitchen is a door to the large master bedroom. When you walk in you find the bed straight ahead (slightly to the left) and further to the left of this on the side wall is a stand tucked away in an alcove. On the wall behind the kitchen is a TV and stand. To the far right is a double door wardrobe with more clothes hangers than most other places and an electronic safe for your valuables. Next to this is a door that leads to the marble tiled ensuite bathroom. As you open the door, the first thing ahead of you is a rain shower on the back wall. To the left is the toilet followed by the vanity - above which hangs a large square back-lit mirror. On the right is a free-standing egg-shaped bath tub which sits in front of the wall of floor to ceiling tempered glass sliding doors – which once opened wide, overlooks the beautiful pool (mentioned earlier).
Back in the living area, to the left of the kitchen are stairs that lead up to the second floor bedroom. At the top of the stairs, a window allows light to penetrate through. Turn right and through the door you will step into the second bedroom. The bed lies against the wall to the right and further in to the left is the second marble tiled ensuite bathroom (this one without a bath tub). On the far side of the bed, floor to ceiling glass sliding doors open up to the outside – this time onto a balcony complete with a large square sun-bed.
The villa is very clean, modern and is a very relaxing place to be in. There are various lights and lamps in the villa for any mood, including the red / blue / white pool lights that can be arranged in any combination. The staff are excellent and available when you need them and they cook you breakfast in your villa at a pre-arranged time but otherwise, you are left to enjoy your surroundings. This is definitely a place I would recommend to others.
**********
The ONLY thing I was baffled by was the placement of the glass shower screen in the master ensuite bathroom. When showering, water would splash onto the floor in front of the vanity because the glass screen faced into the bathroom - it would've made more sense to face the glass screen towards the tempered sliding doors as this was away from the "traffic" area of the bathroom.
title: Beautiful location, beautiful atmosphere, Beautiful Bali Villas

photos.caption: View of pool from master ensuite bathroom

text: As a regular Bali holics, we usually try to find a new place to try and experience. Glad we found them. Great location, staff are very well organized and great breakfast. My wife and I and kids are really enjoys our little break here. Everything is well run and clean. And yes, no mosquito heheh to us is important.
title: A wonderful place

text:
We stayed at Beautiful Bali Villas for a few nights at the end of April.  On arrival we were shown a single bedroom villa with a small pool but my wife asked if this could be swapped for a two storey villa and pool like you see in the picture above.   They swapped the villas, didn't charge us any more but just kept one bedroom locked so they didn't have to clean two.   There were only two of us so we only needed one bedroom and both bedrooms were the same.   The villa we had was next to the street - the pool was fantastic, the bedroom and bathroom good, service excellent and importantly it was all very private.  There is no restaurant or buffet breakfast, however one of the staff will make you breakfast every morning.   Don't expect a big meal - in fact wherever we ate the meals were around half the size of what you would get in Australia (probably a good thing for us fatties).   You can organise transport and sight seeing trips via the office - we didn't find these expensive.   One of the staff, Gede, looked after us and organised then came along on a sight seeing tour to Ubud and surrounds, even coming in to the market to make sure the wife wasn't overcharged for anything.
The villas are on a street the size of a lane, which is used by a million motorbikes all day and all night so ask for a villa away from the street if possible.   Ours was right on the street but the noise didn't worry us - it was all part of the experience.   As other people have said, taxis don't know where the villas are so if you stay there write the address down on a bit of paper to show drivers where to go.   
It has free wifi but we found that dropped out sometimes.  In fact we had the same issue wherever we stayed.   It wasn't a big concern as who goes on holidays to sit on facebook?
It isn't far to the beach but it'll take a bit of time as all the people in the shops will try to stop you to sell you something - they generally had success with my wife :)
We stayed at three different places whilst in Bali, and this villa was the nicest.   I would definately stay there again.
title: Great villa, great service, good location.

photos.caption: Gedde, one of the staff who took us sightseeing
downstairs open lounge and dining area next to the pool
the private pool - picture taken from upstairs bedroom

text:
Quiet - Even it's next to Jl. Legian of few miles, but there's no annoying sounds or safety worries during the night.
Friendly workers - They are always willing to help us, and also cooked awesome Balinese breakfast for us.
Tranquil atmosphere - Stayed one night with my family members there, and enjoy the accompany among us without any disturbing of annoying sounds. 
In all, can't complain for sure :))
title: Quiet+Friendly workers+Tranquil atmosphere= Amazing!

photos.caption: Balinese fried rice as our breakfast.
Night view of the swimming pool.

text: Stayed for 12 nights with my family. Brilliant location, 10 minute walk to the beach.  Lovely friendly staff. Breakfast cooked daily in your Villa. Just a few steps from the main shopping area.  Definitely recommend. Taxis have a hard time finding it, being  one way street caused troube, but when you say North Legian Street then they know how to get to it.
title: Brilliant Villa in the Heart of Legian

text:
Wow...just WOW. What a fantastic place to stay. My wife and another couple booked to stay at Beautiful Bali Villas for 14 nights and 14 nights was way to short! This place is the BEST accommodation in Bali without a doubt - we have stayed at 5 star resorts in Bali previously and although very nice, they didn't offer to friendly manner, convenience and total privacy that Beautiful Bali Villas does.

My birthday fell on a day whilst we were there and at 8.30am, just before our breakfast was being served in our Villa, all of the staff turned up with a Birthday cake and sang "Happy Birthday" to me....that's something I will never forget!!!

The Villa are modern, clean and very private - our own pool was certainly well used after hot days sightseeing and the Villa was always clean and tidy on our return - bed turndown at night was also a nice touch

The location is very central to Legian and the beach - a 10 minute walk to the beach (an hour if you stop to shop!) and many many restaurants close by. Taxi drivers don't know where it is which caused an initial problem but after befriending a Taxi driver we only used him and texted him when we needed a ride - our personal Taxi!!

We hired scooters for the last couple of days which was both fun and convenient - we figured that 11 days of watching the traffic mayhem had given us enough confidence to venture out by ourselves - we had no problems and whole lot of fun - the staff at the Villas organised these for us.

Would we stay here again??......we wont stay anywhere else!!!
title: Fantastic, Magnificent....Beautiful..!!

text:
It was our second visit to Bali and a friend recommend to stay here. We booked a 2 bedroom villa. Our stay was fantastic, the staff were very friendly and I loved having a private pool. 

The rooms were also well equipped it really did feel like a home away from home. The staff were great too. They suggested a few restaurants within the local area to try. 

Overall I would love to stay here again.
title: Fantastic recommendation

text: i stay for 3 days with my family in 2 bed room villa. closed to the beach just 10 min walk,staf was amazing very helpfull and frendly "gede n agus is the best" will come back again stay here ican't say alot for this villa. lovely..
title: Lovely villa

text: Had a fantastic time here. Our one bedroom villa was spacious with a beautiful bath overlooking the private pool. Very close to the beach and Padma shopping. The staff were very accommodating and so helpful. Transfer from the airport was seamless and the 24hr security around the villa was friendly. Breakfast was tasty The perfect getaway!
title: great experience

text:
We stayed here for 13 days, having stayed in quite a few villas in Bali as well as hotels this one looked fantastic. On arrival we where so disappointed. They say close to the river, well it was filthy dirty and smelly. When we where taken into the villa it was nothing like the pictures. It is run by a lot of young people with no senior to manage them.

There is no bath and the hot water is hit and miss. There was where 4 of us and a 3 year old, first morning at breakfast we asked for eggs for all of us to be told that they only supplied breakfast for 4 people so our grandson could not have any. That's shocked us as we asked well what does he get for breakfast to be told we have to supply it. 

The same towels where folded and reused, a couple of days at around 12pm we had to go ask if our villa could actually be cleaned and they were not full.. The young staff where very helpful and friendly they just need a manager to push them. We went to Bintang supermarket and brought some cleaning cloth's and spray and wipe so we could clean the kitchen properly ourselves.

The swimming pool got cleaned 3 times while we where there and was very cold, I asked for a pool fence before we arrived as other villas we have stayed in and where a lot cheaper than this one erected one free of charge, this villa wanted $60us per day, I hired one from Bali Baby hire for $10 per day. Location wise it is fantastic it's only a 5 min walk to all the main attractions. It is a lot of money for little service though. Will we stay there again, definitely not.
title: Very Very Dissapointed

text:
We stayed at the Villas for 1 week at the end of September 2014.
We stayed in Villa 1.  It is a 2 bedroom villa, but it was just Myself and Wife, so we used it as a single bedroom.
Straight away, the staff here excellent - friendly and accommodating.  We had breakfast cooked for us (at a time of our request) every morning - a choice of local or western - we chose local (rice or noodle) - it was lovely (I think they were a bit surprised we didn't want bacon & eggs every morning!)
Location - Excellent.  Far enough away from the rat race of Kuta, but still good for shopping etc.  About 5 - 7 min walk to beach - straight down Padma Rd.  Shopping all down Padma - but some good markets at the end of Garlic Lane (Left off Padma just after the Legion Pub).
The Villas themselves are excellent.  Each has their own pool - which is a good size.  Indoor / outdoor living is excellent and they are very well appointed.
Only 1 negative point (which didn't worry us) - there is a bit of traffic noise.  The villas are located on Padma Rd which is quite busy - BUT nothing that worried us in the slightest.
We had a great stay & will be back again very soon.
We loved it!
Thanks to all the staff.
Cheers - Chris
title: Great Place to Stay...

text: We stayed here for a week in September. We travelled with 2 adult children, then were surprised by the visit of another adult child, a surprise for Fathers Day.  The staff at the villa were brilliant about it. We all loved this place so much. It was perfect. I can't say enough good things about it. From the beautiful staff, the pool, comfort, the location - everything was superb.  The staff even found my husband and I somewhere to stay in seminyak for another week (after we had finally got rid of the 'kids'. I can't wait to go back!
title: Absolutely beautiful Beautiful Bali Villas

text: I cant praise this place enough. The staff are amazing and aim to please. Each villa has a private pool and awesome indoor -outdoor layout, that captures that open Bali feel. Great attention to detail. The bedroom is upstairs , also private with its own balcony. Great showers (indoor and one outdoor by the pool) lovely gardens in villa 2. Reasonably priced and an absolute must if you stay in Bali. Love love loved it!
title: Amazing stay... A luxury must in Bali

text: Thoroughly enjoyed my relaxing stay here. The pool was located right next to my living area which gives you that indoor/outdoor Bali feel. The villas were located 5 mins walk to all the shops but off the main street so it was nice and quiet. Bed was comfortable and it felt like home for 9 days. Service from the staff was amazing specially from Mr Oka Osbala he stood out from all the staff at beautiful bali villas he gave me a first class service plus I became good friends with me he made my holiday I was very disappointed with the building work right next to my villa door but I had a fantastic holiday kind regards Gareth.
title: Serenity in Bali 15/08/2014 To 24/08/2014

text:
We booked this villa 7 months before we traveled to Bali. On the day we were to check-in, our driver rang to confirm the address and was told we were going to be staying at another of the owners villas as someone else had decided to extend their stay in the villa we booked. The other villa (although lovely) was a couple of kilometres from Padma Road, which was where our friends were staying. After some negotiation it was agreed that we could move into the villa we had booked. From that moment on, our stay was perfect. Thankyou Gede, thankyou Agus.
Legian is a very loud, busy area. Beautiful Bali Villas is located a short walk from the busy shopping streets, restaurants and the beach. It is just far enough away to provide peace and quiet and a good nights sleep, but close enough to feel like everything is at your fingertips.
The villa is well designed and clean. The beds are great. The breakfasts (cooked in your villa) are delicious and every member of staff is courteous and helpful. The staff can help with everything from tours to pizza delivery. They even arranged a babysitter for us. Wonderful people. Thankyou.
I would recommend Beautiful Bali Villas to anyone looking to stay in Legian.
title: A little piece of quiet in Legian

text: Thoroughly enjoyed our relaxing stay here. The pool was located right next to our open living area which gives you that indoor/outdoor Bali feel. The villas were located 5 mins walk to all the shops but off the main street so it was nice and quiet. Bed was comfortable and it felt like home for 5 days. Service from the staff was friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was delicious and prepared in our villa each morning. Looking forward to another stay soon!
title: Serenity in Bali

text: Just finished a week stay in 3 bedroom pool villa at beautiful bali villas.. Wow! Amazing villas, modern and good layout. But the service from all staff and location was the best! Organised drivers and helped us whenever we needed it.My girlfriends and I had a beautiful relaxing time and will definitely be back! Thank you guys for giving us the best experience! From Nicole, Jennah and Jodi!
title: Luxury holiday with great service!

text:
The service I received during my stay was amazing! The staff were so helpful and friendly. 

First time travelling to Bali wasn't sure where to stay!?

My family and I had a very good experience. I didn't even have to cook that was the best part! The staff did all the thinking for me.  

The villa we stayed in was clean, comfortable, modern and a short walk to the local shops and beach. The rooms were well equipped. Having a private pool was also so handy, I didn't have to worry about the kids. 

I also loved how the staff were easy going and gave us lots of great local tips. 

We will be returning!
title: Beautiful indeed

text: I went with my best friend , my daughter and her best friend. We celebrated my daughters 21st in Bali . The villas are central to many things. Close if you want to walk to beach (5mins). Lots of eateries and shopping all within walking distance. The rooms were very clean and airy . Beds were very comfy . The staff were always obliging/helpful to any needs that we needed. Very friendly always smiling. I asked for my daughters room to be decorated with balloons and make it look festive  and the bath was covered in flower petals saying HBD. It looked beautiful and super cheap ($100 AUS). The villa had all that we needed for our holiday.
title: We will be back 🤩

text:
Booked this based on TA reviews and, in our opinion, we were disappointed. We stayed in better (and much cheaper) villas this trip in Sanur and Ubud.

We arrived slightly early and left our luggage. When we returned our bags were left unattended and in public reach - no apology!

Access to the main Legian centre is down a narrow laneway busy with local traffic and can be quite hazardous. Traffic noise into the night and early morning.

Rooms are good size and adequately furnished but nothing flash. Beds were comfortable. Toilets were blocked when we arrived and needed fixing twice during our two day stay. Pool is nice but sadly the floor of ours was green in places and piles of debris that was never cleared. Upstairs balcony was neglected, dirty, had rubbish on it, no seating so why bother with it?

Information on TA listing says “free one way airport transfer” - NO ITS DOES NOT! They wanted 270,000rph!! We got a Bluebird taxi for 70,000.

Staff were friendly enough but the villas still need work doing. Guess covid took its toll so for now they should be reducing their fees.
title: Disappointing. Had hoped for better based on TA reviews

text: After staying here in 2018 and loving it so much, we were so disappointed to see how much these villas have lost their shine. We were initially checked in to a villa that was not very hospitable. The pool was so full of algae that it was not safe to swim in. The bedroom I suspect had water damage, the wooden floor was buckled and unstable in areas. The Villa also smelled of mould and sewerage. We requested a Villa change quickly and the staff were fantastic and accommodating. The Villa we were moved to had a pool that was in better condition although it was not maintained well as there was still quite a lot of algae present. The kitchen was very dirty, grimy handles on the cupboards and in need of a deep clean. The water filter was dirty and there were no shelves in the fridge. There was also a large patch of black mould growing on the ceiling. We had originally booked for 4 days but left after 2 after we had half a day with no water (not fun when you can’t flush the toilet with Travellers bum) and then the air con stopped working in the bedroom. I don’t like leaving negative reviews but I think some attention to maintenance and an increase in standards would help bring these Bali villas back to beautiful again.
title: Disappointing

text:
We went as a family of four (2 daughters) and stayed in a 3 bedroom villa. It was fantastic! Private, clean, spacious, secure and a great pool to cool off in. The perfect base for exploring Bali.
All of the staff were amazing and friendly. In particular Githa and Yulie who couldn't do enough for us - we love these guys! The breakfasts in the morning were delicious especially the Nasi Goreng. The location is about 10 minutes from the beach and less to the main street. 
We loved spending time on the beach in the evening watching the sunset and enjoying ice cold beers and food on the beach. We will most definately will be coming back, highly recommend the villas! This is one of the best, if not the best holiday that we have been on as a family. Thank you to Beautiful Bali Villas.
title: Amazing Family Holiday

text:
It’s with a heavy heart that I can only give 3 stars because the management staff did all they could to make our stay more comfortable.  The beautiful villa requires property owner maintenance to be at the standard advertised.  The road pollution, noise, direct sunlight and humidity made for an unpleasant stay until we were moved to an enclosed villa which was what I expected from the start of our stay.  Being put in an open villa mean that local animals had access,  the surfaces were sticky, unclean and mildew had developed.  Additionally the bathrooms and bedrooms never failed to produce a putrid smell we all likened to sewerage smell.  To rectify this enclosing the apartment and protecting it from the elements would go a long way.   

Once we were moved we were much more comfortable but I again the beautiful villa needs maintenance.  Deck boards have rotted and cupboards have become loose, the tapware needs attention as well as the floors in the bathroom where my husband had a nasty slip and fall in the shiny stone shower.  Again all issues for property owners not the management staff.  

Thanks to the staff for doing your best, nothing was ever too much trouble and we really appreciate all that you did for us.
title: Wonderful management staff

text: We are a group of 5 ladies in our 40s and stayed at Beautiful Bali Villas for a week.  We loved the location, only about a 5 - 10 minute walk to the beach with lots of shops on the way to look at.  The beds were all King sized so some of the girls shared and I had my own room.  Breakfast was whatever time we ordered it and was delicious.  I loved the fresh fruit platter each day and the nasi goreng.  The staff were super friendly and I would definately stay here again.  There is also a good money changer 5 minutes walk down the road (central kuta money exchange) and they have a 24 hour reception and a security guard at night so you feel nice and safe:-). If I had any small issues they would just be that their white towels need replacing as they were turning grey.  The lights in the villas are really dim so it is hard to see in the bathroom mirror when putting on makeup, but this could be so they don't attract mosquitoes.  Also we found the door of our villa difficult to lock.  Still loved it though, I will be back:-)
title: Wonderful Week

text:
The staff at Beautiful Bali Villas are magnificent!!!  We have 2 very active boys, 4yo and 2yo, and the first night we stayed in a villa that wasn’t completely suitable with upstairs bedrooms and no pool fence. We had requested  with the booking agency to have a fence but the villas were not informed. As we were quite nervous of the open pool the staff had a pool fence onsite and around the pool within 90mins which was a massive weight of our minds. They even brought some pool toys for the boys as well. The next day we were moved to a more suitable villa and it was fantastic. Beautiful pool and ensuitenthat opened up to it and cold air con.

Every morning breakfast was cooked in our villa and nothing was a bother for the staff. They came back through the day while we were out and about and cleaned the kitchen as well. The security staff were very polite and no matter how wild the boys got with excitement the staff were always happy to see them and had so much patience. Bill the owner is a man that really cares about his guests also and takes pride what they are offering.

We found the location very good as we could get taxis to Seminyak and Kuta for under $5 AUD and Padma Street had plenty of good places to eat and shop. 

We stayed the last few nights at The Hard Rock Hotel and while it was great for many different reasons..... Beautiful Bali Villas will be our choice of accommodation for the entire stay whenever we stay in this area of Bali. 

Banjo and Angus miss you guys already! :)

text:
I stayed in a lovely 2 bedroom villa with friends and honestly never wanted to leave.

The villa has everything you need - massive bedrooms, with huge beds, a private pool, a sunny balcony, 2 AMAZING bathrooms with one facing out onto the pool and all the other facilities you need.

It really is suitable for any type of holiday - If you want to just relax, you have everything you need and you wouldn't even need to leave the villa. The lovely staff come and cook for you in your villa and you can even get someone to give you a massage in your villa. The staff here are always professional, friendly, polite and attentive and nothing is too much to ask. It's in the middle of everything - so if you do want to leave the villa you are close to all of the amazing places you can imagine. Yet somehow it is so quiet and peaceful on the side street, you wouldn't even know how close you are to everything.

When I come back to Bali, I won't be staying anywhere else!!! I've stayed many places in Bali before, from hotels, to cottages, to villas and this is by far the best in all aspects.

Thank you so much Beautiful Bali Villas! I can't wait to see you all again.

text:
We arrived to beautiful Bali villas very late at night and we still were welcomed with a big hello with loads of smiles from staff at the reception. Once we got into our beautiful private villa, we were blown away with how clean and modern the villa was with also a touch of traditional Balinese decor. We stayed in a two bed room villa, 1 bed room down stairs and 1 bedroom upstairs. Both with private bathrooms/baths. The location is absolutely amazing to, so close to Legian street where all restaurants/night life is and only a 5min walk down to Legian beach. Still far enough away for everything to be peaceful tho :) 
Throughout our whole stay, the staff at beautiful Bali villas were absolutely AMAZING! So kind and generous. They are the main reason why I would go back again and stay at beautiful Bali villas. Having your breakfast cooked for you every morning in the privacy of your own villa with such beautiful staff, is the best way to start your day in Bali. “Pipit” is a lovely Lady who works at reception and she really went above and beyond to make our stay amazing. She is so friendly and caring :) we will definitely miss seeing her face everyday! I can not recommend beautiful Bali villas more!! You will not be disappointed with your stay here :) please be kind to all the staff cause they are all amazing people and deserve so much happiness.

text:
These gorgeous villas are a 9/10 

Great things:
- great location
- walking distance to multiple restaurants, shops
- less than 10 minute walk to the beach
- Friendly & extremely helpful staff (helped with transport, knowledge of the area etc)
- Wifi was really good 
- Netflix in lounge room (BYO account)
- Breakfast is good
- Pool is nice and relaxing
- Bathrooms are clean
- Bed was comfy 
- Air conditioning kept the room very cool, perfect for the hot/muggy climate of Bali 

Not so great things (barely any):
- No Netflix/DVD player in bedroom
- wifi did cut out for nearly a whole day, which is not the villas fault but still annoying
- Pillowcases weren’t changed during our stay (10 nights) 
- our gate (villa 9) didn’t lock properly and could be easily pushed open even when locked with the key. However the villa has 24/7 security and the front door to the villa was very secure when locked.

The staff make this place amazing, perfect for a long or short stay, will definitely be recommending to friends!

text:
We've just arrived home after a six night stay at Beautiful Bali Villas. It was bliss! 

We got a fantastic deal on the price of this accommodation and when we saw the villa in person, we couldn't believe it. Add in friendly staff cooking your full breakfast each morning in your kitchen and it really became unbeatable. 

Things we loved:

1. Very private. Staff came in for breakfast, cooked, served and left. They always waited until we left before cleaning the rooms. The bed was turned down and mosquito spray administered quickly each night. It was wonderful to have this level of privacy in a villa. 

2. The pool was gorgeous. Great depth, beautifully clean, perfect temperature and received good sun for a few solid hours each day. We loved coming home and diving straight in to cool off. The bean bags to lounge in by the pool were so comfy and a great way to sun bake. 

3. The bath over looking the pool was my happy place. Comfortable, gorgeous hot water, lovely to soak in. Take a nice bath soak / body wash and treat yourself! 

4. The air conditioning was awesome, especially in the bedroom. Icy cool. Never turned off by staff. 

5. The breakfasts each day were delicious. Staff were so friendly and accommodating. I adored being fussed over whilst I sat on my backside and did nothing! Full holiday mode! 

6. Great location. 200 meters and you're in the heart of Legian. 800 meter walk to the beach. 

7. The bed was very comfortable. Great mattress. 

8. The villa was very secure as it was staffed 24/7. This was reassuring. 

I'm now trying to think of negatives (it's hard). 

1. The shower head sprayed water all about the place and floor did get slippery afterwards. Nothing a quick wipe couldn't fix. 

2. Netflix on the bedroom TV would have been great (it was on the lounge room TV but the bedroom TV only had Fox channels). 

That's it on the negatives for us!

I highly recommend Beautiful Bali Villas and would very happily return. Definitely worth a visit!
title: Bliss at Beautiful Bali Villas

text:
We had a fantastic 10 days in a 2 bed villa.
On arrival we were given the wrong villa, as it was 11.30pm when we arrived we agreed to move the following day.
Our villa was lovely but not as nice as in the listing photos.
However it had everything we needed and we thoroughly enjoyed our trip.
The staff were lovely. Very obliging.
The villas are so central. Minutes walk to Legian St and an amazing little Warung Anka opposite which we fully recommend. There are two laundry services a minute away as well.
The breakfasts were delicious and my husband is now proficient in nasi goreng as the chef taught him how to make the perfect one.
The bedrooms and bathrooms were massive, plenty of storage and the a/c was icy cold.
Security 24 hours was good as well, along with CCTV.
Our only gripes were that we only had a small fridge when the villas are advertised as having a big fridge/ freezer.
The above head shower in our bathroom sprayed water everywhere and really wasn't nice to use, and the pools only have one big step which isn't that easy to get in or out of.
Our villa, no 8, didn't get much sun in the pool either.

text:
Ok to start the staff are wonderful, very helpful and quick to respond to any requests!
So why three stars?
We arrived and went into our villa very nice pool clean nice lounge area and kitchen looks clean all good, we went up to our room and noticed that it wasn't that cool so change the air con settings but still not cool!
Went and chatted to the young lad on reception and he said he will have a look, 5 mins later he was in the room checking it out and said yes doesn't seem to be working he will get a tech on it, not ideal but these things happen!
Tech had a look and said there was not enough gas so he had added extra give it half an hour and should be ok!
So an hour latter I went back to reception and said still no good, tech went up on the roof again and said the aircon was leaking and asked if we could stay in the next villa for one night no problem!
Nice and cool to sleep in there so the next day tech comes to fix air con we go out for the day, come back around 2.20pm Reception tells me all fixed fantastic and thanks for resolving the problem go to room still warm ok back to reception and tell him still hot, tells me he will check again an hour later comes up to villa and tells me aircon is working but our room only has a 1.0kw aircon but the other rooms (nice and cold) have 1.5kw systems so now we know why but there is no fix!
Found if we kept the curtains closed all day and the onsuite door closed we could get it a little cooler, now these villas are not cheap and I was not happy but not a staff problem that they can fix so one of the reasons for the 3 star review but not the only reason!
Yes I know a long story but I wanted everyone to know the staff did what they could but it was not fixable!
Villa was nice pool clean and nice to use, Breakfast was good and mostly ontime!
Now location is not ideal you are quite a way out of legian and the road to the villa has no path, if my kids where young I would have to carry them as the road gets very busy and I was clipped by a scooter while trying to navigate to the beach, not much in the area so you need to walk a while!
Again I would like to thank the staff and think the owners need to update the aircon in one of the rooms!
Good holiday we had fun but a bit to warm to sleep well!
title: Beautiful Bali Villas

text:
I stayed with friends in one of their three bedroom villa's in June this year. Fantastic location close to all the favourite shops, markets and eateries. It was very comfortable. We had our own open lounge / living area, pool and a decent kitchen and a huge fridge & toilet on the ground floor. Each morning we had two of the staff come and cook our order for us. You order what you want the day before for the following morning. 

The three large rooms were upstairs off a balcony.  Each room had it's own key with a deadlock. Each room had it's own safe inside the wardrobe, decent sized ensuite, king sized bed and A/C. 

The staff were pleasant, helpful and friendly. Security are on duty 24 hrs. 

With the Villa we were in, we got sun for about midday to approximately 2pm. The surrounds make it very private, which was nice and you have a key to lock your villa's door downstairs. 

This place could do with some maintenance. My ensuite had a bad leak coming from the sink in the bathroom, which I reported. Obviously it had been leaking for some time as the wood on the cupboards in the ensuite was swollen. I did report it. 

Some new furniture would make it more asthetically appealing downstairs in the lounge / living area.
title: Great Location

text:
We have stayed in many villas in Bali over the years and have seen many different standards. Beautiful Bali Villas is up there in the top ones. Quiet location, no screaming motorbike noises or dogs barking all hours of the night. Very clean, great fresh decor and fantastically helpful staff. Breakfast was as expected and not intrusive. Strongly recommend asking the staff to burn mosquito coils at night as the villas back onto a river and the mosquitoes are plentiful (no worse than other villas and hotels). 
Easy laneway walk to Legian and Padma streets and safe at night. Laundry across the lane (Dudy) very very cheap and fantastic results.

text: Beautiful bali villas are exactly that beautiful stunning design with all the rooms facing on to our sparkling  blue pool .the staff are beautiful too truly they made us feel so welcome and having 24 hr securtity  and staff has hotel feel but very much feels also like a divine big holiday house .. location location fantastic ....perfect right in the super bustle of legian  shops cafe beach all down the road then step back in to the oasis straight in the pool....we went with our two almost teenage boys they loved the villa suited family perfectly ..want to go back to the villas with a whole bunch of girlfreinds and relax and enjoy the luxury the tranquility and beauty of it all all over again ...hmm dream on .. thanks beautiful bali villas best holiday thanks to you all ... clare weston
